alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northwest Aroostook; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 12:48AM EST until January 15 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...BLOWING SNOW ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills and blowing snow. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northeast Aroostook, Northwest Aroostook, Southeast Aroostook and Northern Penobscot Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 1 PM EST this afternoon. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM EST this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and cause localized hazardous travel. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and the wind will create dangerously low wind chill values. Frostbite can occur quickly and even hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken. A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means that visibilities will be limited due to strong winds blowing snow around. Use caution when traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northwest Aroostook; Southeast Aroostook
